Welcome to all new members of this mailing list and user ryhorikawa 
who is=
 associated with the UW.

I lived in Madison WI for a few years and in fact=
 a bulk of the research 
for SHINSENGUMIHQ (SHQ ) was completed at the UW's=
 Memorial 
Library and the Wisconsin State Historical Society.  There are 
=
many "little" treasures and artifacts right in Memorial Union from the 
Mei=
ji Era and some Wisconsinites had interesting connections to 19th 
century =
Japan. 

You may all have already asked yourselves..."well WHAT happened to=
 
SHQ.com?"

Earlier this year, the SHQ hosting company must have experienc=
ed a 
technical glitch which erased an html file which is basically where a=
ll 
pages of the website are stored (a database pulls info from this html 
=
file).  The html file was deleted and it's not clear what happened.  
FOrtu=
nately Barbara Sheridan had a back up file of everything and from 
this fil=
e an e-book will be written.

The e-book will be designed to be user friend=
ly for people new to this 
slice of history and yet written and cited in su=
ch a way to make it a 
helpful research resource.  The e-book will be in a =
pdf format for easy 
download and should any new additional information be =
added, it will be 
mentioned on an update page.

From examining the SHQ ser=
ver, it was obvious to me that new visitors 
tended to dwell on popular pag=
es and never visited the really really 
detailed timeline (if one studies i=
t the Shinsengumi narrative emerges).  
Hopefully by writing an e-book, vis=
itors will be able to have everything in 
front of them and will be able to=
 understand the Shinsengumi and their 
world better.

It took all of us man=
y years of growth, research and reflection on not 
only the Shinsengumi but=
 Aizu-han as well to realize that our fansite can 
be a helpful starting po=
int for people who have just discovered the 
fascinating/notorious/controve=
rsial Shinsengumi.

The site will move to a new server and will continue to=
 host fanwork, 
art, vids, stories etc.

This summer, 2008, a first draft o=
f the book will be completed and 
undergo an editing process.

We would als=
o like to throw a "re-opening" party if possible and look 
forward to recon=
necting with everyone.

~secretarytocapt3
